      • charset

        public MailMock charset(Charset charset)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Sets the charset. This charset is used when encoding headers and as the charset parameter in the body content type (text/plain; charset=..., text/html; charset=...). The default value is Mail.DEFAULT_CHARSET.
        Specified by:
        charset in interface Mail

      • bodyEncoding

        public MailMock bodyEncoding(@Nullable
                    Encoding encoding)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Sets the body encoding. This encoding is used only when encoding a body. For attachments there's a separate encoding setting.
        Specified by:
        bodyEncoding in interface Mail
        Parameters:
        encoding - If null the encoding will be auto-detected in order to optimize the encoded content size.
        See Also:
        Mail.attachmentEncoding(Encoding)

      • attachmentEncoding

        public MailMock attachmentEncoding(Encoding encoding)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Sets the attachment encoding. This encoding is used when encoding an attachment. For bodies there's a separate encoding setting.
        Specified by:
        attachmentEncoding in interface Mail
        Parameters:
        encoding - Must not be null since the auto-detection is not supported for attachments.
        See Also:
        Mail.bodyEncoding(Encoding)

      • address

        public MailMock address(AddressType type,
               String addresses)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Adds the specified addresses to the address header specified by type. If needed the personal parts will be encoded according to the RFC822 using the charset.

        Some examples: 

             .address(AddressType.FROM, "from@example.com")
     .address(AddressType.TO, "John Doe <to@example.com>")
     .address(AddressType.CC, "♡ Unicode ♡ <cc1@example.com>, cc2@example.com")
     .address(AddressType.CC, "cc1@example.com")
     .address(AddressType.CC, "cc2@example.com")
        Specified by:
        address in interface Mail
        addresses - one or more addresses encoded according to RFC822. Unicode personal part doesn't have to be encoded (see examples above).

      • address

        public MailMock address(AddressType type,
               String address,
               @Nullable
               String personal)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Adds a single address to the address header specified by type. An optional personal may be specified and if needed it will be encoded according to the RFC822 using the charset.

        Note that this method is different from Mail.address(AddressType, String) in that the address must be a single local@domain address without the personal part (it may be specified as the personal parameter).

        Specified by:
        address in interface Mail

      • subject

        public MailMock subject(String subject)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Sets the Subject header. If needed the value will be encoded according to the RFC822 using the charset.
        Specified by:
        subject in interface Mail

        public MailMock body(BodyType type,
            String value)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Adds a body of the specified type. If the body of this type already exists it's overwritten with the new value. The bodyEncoding will be used to encode the body content.
        Specified by:
        body in interface Mail

        Description copied from interface: Mail

        Specified by:

        name - the name that will appear as attachment filename in a mail client
        type - the content type. If null it will be auto-detected.

      • template

        public MailMock template(String name,
                @Nullable
                Locale locale,
                Map<String,?> context)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        Applies the template specified by name.
        Specified by:
        template in interface Mail
        Parameters:
        name - the template name. The semantics is template engine specific.
        locale - optional locale to render the template in. If null the default locale is used.

      • template

        public MailMock template(String name,
                @Nullable
                Locale locale,
                Object... context)
        Description copied from interface: Mail
        A version of Mail.template(String, Locale, Map) with the context passed as varargs parameter.

        The following code 

             Mail m = ...;
     m.template("template name", null,
                "key1", "value1",
                "key2", "value2");
        does the same as 
             Map<String, Object> context = new LinkedHashMap<>();
     context.put("key1", "value1");
     context.put("key2", "value2");

     Mail m = ...;
     m.template("template name", null, context);
        Specified by:
        template in interface Mail
        context - a flattened map in a form of a (key, value) pair sequence

        public MailMock template(String name,
                Map<String,?> context)
